text: Hans-Peter Kaul (25 July 1943 â€“ 21 July 2014) was a German international law scholar and former diplomat and international judge. From 11 March 2003 until 1 July 2014, he served as Judge at the International Criminal Court in The Hague. At the ICC, Judge Kaul was President of the Pre-Trial Division from 2004 until March 2009 and again in 2014. He was also the Court's Vice- President from 2009 to 2012. In 2014, he resigned from the ICC for health reasons but his condition became worse. Kaul died on 22 July 2014, aged 70. ==References== Category:1943 births Category:2014 deaths Category:German judges Category:People from Saxony
title: Hans-Peter Kaul
